description: The Huracan Foundation's first project (in 2012) was based in Sierra Leone and was run in conjunction with the Craig Bellamy Children's Foundation
Following our support for Vikas in 2013, his team went on to form an NGO Just for Kicks which now works with over 5,000 children each year across India and employees 80 people
This project led by Henry May led to the creation of CoSchool, the social enterprise lestablished by Henry that focuses on chidren's social and emotional learning

Dickson's project was run in conjunction with Nakuru Youth Sports Association. The children still wear the Huracan kit they received back in 2013 although many of the original players have gone on to bigger and better things. One of the original members of Huracan FC Kenya is now playing in the Kenya Premier League

Daniel's project focused on reducing teenage pregnancies. Four girls in the team fell pregnant in the first year, but this number fell to zero in the second year of the project thanks to the support they received from Daniel and their focus on playing as part of the team.
Thad led a project based in a region of Brazil plagued by drug barons with a focus of providing a safe space for children where they could play football in their freetime
Diana Paola worked with the children using football to improve their respect for each other and help build resilience
Miggy was using football to focuus on improvind discipline and the boys attitude at his school in Manila
This project was based in a very remote village in the mountains of Nepal, three hours by car from the local town and then one hour on foot
Diana Paola's project had a strong focus on girls XXX
Jaime's project was based in a very rural school in San Pedro de Uruba, xxx

locationName: Hin Shen Village, Shoushi Region, Nagorno-Karabakh

projectName: Huracan FC St Frances De Sales
